This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If the priest expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 1st.

trait.name: Preserve Life (Recharges After a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The priest targets up to six creatures it can see within 30 feet. The priest heals these creatures, dividing up 30 hit points between them.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

monster.name: Acolyte of Light

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Acolytes are junior members of the clergy, usually answerable to a priest. They perform a variety of functions in a temple and are granted minor spellcasting power by their deities.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The acolyte is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The acolyte has following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Divine Eminence
entries: As a bonus action, the priest can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage to a target on a hit. This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If the priest expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 1st.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Radiance of the Dawn ({@recharge 5})
entries: Each creature within 30 feet of the priest that can see it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ((@dice 2d10+3}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

monster.name: Acolyte of Nature

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Charm Animals and Plants (Recharge After a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Each animal and plant within 30 feet of the priest that can see and hear it must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is charmed by the priest until the end of its next turn.

monster.description: Acolytes are junior members of the clergy, usually answerable to a priest. They perform a variety of functions in a temple and are granted minor spellcasting power by their deities.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The acolyte is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The acolyte has following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Divine Eminence
entries: As a bonus action, the priest can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage to a target on a hit. This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If the priest expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 1st.

trait.name: Charm Animals and Plants (Recharge After a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Each animal and plant within 30 feet of the priest that can see and hear it must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is charmed by the priest until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Charger
entries: If the cavalier moves at least 20 feet in a straight line towards a creature and then hits it with a lance attack, the creature takes an additional 6 ({@damage 1d12}) piercing damage and must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Saddle Master
entries: The cavalier has advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off its mount. If the cavalier falls off its mount and descends no more than 10 feet, it can land on its feet, and it isn't incapacitated. Dismounting a creature only takes 5 feet of movement for the cavalier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If the cavalier is mounted, it can make two lance attacks. These attacks cannot be made against the same target.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. *Hit:* 10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) piercing damage. The cavalier has disadvantage on this attack if it isn't mounted.

action.name: War Pick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Warding Maneuvers
entries: When a creature the cavalier can see targets the cavalier or its mount with an attack, the cavalier adds 2 to the AC of both itself and its mount against attacks from that creature until the start of the cavalier's next turn.

trait.name: Arcane Shot (1/Turn)
entries: When the archer hits a creature with a ranged weapon attack, it can apply one of the following effects to the target in addition to the damage of the attack:

Grasping Arrow.** The target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, its speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it is overwhelmed by brambles, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage the first time on each turn it moves 1 foot or more without teleporting. The target or any creature that can reach it can use its action to remove the brambles. Otherwise, they last for 1 minute.
Shadow Arrow.** The target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage, and it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be blinded until the start of the archer's next turn.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The archer has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Magic Arrows
entries: The archer's ranged weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: The archer can take the Hide action when lightly obscured by natural phenomena.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The archer makes two attacks with its longbow.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. *Hit:* 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Piercing Arrow (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The archer looses a magic arrow in a 30 foot by 1 foot line, passing harmlessly through objects and ignoring cover. Each creature in the line must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Speech of the Woods
entries: The arch shepherd can communicate with animals as if they share a language. Most beasts lack the intelligence to convey complex ideas, but can express emotions and short memories with ease.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Animal Aura (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The arch shepherd chooses a point within 60 feet that it can see and calls forth an aura with a 30-foot radius around that point. The arch shepherd can move the aura up to 60 feet to a point it can see as a bonus action. The aura persists for 1 minute or until the arch shepherd is incapacitated. The aura has one of the following effects:

action.name: Bear Aura
entries: Each creature in the aura when it appears gains 14 ({@dice 4d6}) temporary hit points and has advantage on Strength checks and saving throws while in the aura.

action.name: Fox Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn in the aura can use its bonus action to Dash, Disengage, or Hide on that turn.

action.name: Hawk Aura
entries: When a creature in the aura makes an attack roll, the arch shepherd can use its reaction to grant advantage on that roll.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: All aranea are 3rd-level wizards. The Aranea's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks) and require no material components for their spells. Typical known spells are listed below, but individual aranea can know different spells.

trait.name: Moonlight Hearth
entries: During a short or long rest, the dream guardian touches a point in space, and an invisible, 30-foot-radius sphere of magic appears, centered on that point. Total cover blocks the sphere. While within the sphere, the dream guardian and its allies gain a +5 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) and Wisdom (Perception) checks, and any light from open flames in the sphere isn't visible outside of it. The sphere vanishes at the end of the rest or when the dream guardian leaves the sphere.

trait.name: Summer Balm (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the dream guardian blesses a creature it can see within 120 feet of it. The target regains 10 ({@dice 3d6}) hit points and 9 temporary hit points.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: All aranea are 3rd-level wizards. The Aranea's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks) and require no material components for their spells. Typical known spells are listed below, but individual aranea can know different spells.

trait.name: Totem of the Wolf (1/turn)
entries: When the barbarian hits a Large or smaller creature with a melee weapon attack, it can choose to force the target to make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. The target falls prone on a failed save.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The barbarian's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13). It can cast the following spells innately, but only as a ritual:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The barbarian makes four attacks with its scimitars.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Aura of Protection
entries: The kingsguard and friendly creatures within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws.

trait.name: Sacred Weapons
entries: The kingsguard's weapon attacks are magical. When the kingsguard hits with its morningstar, the weapon deals an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage (included in the attack).

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kingsguard's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells innately without expending somatic or material components.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kingsguard makes three attacks with its morningstar.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Divine Sense (3/Day)
entries: Until the end of the kingsguard's next turn, it knows the location of any celestial, fiend, or undead within 60 feet of it that is not behind total cover. It knows the type of creature but not its identity.

action.name: Water Whip
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. *Hit:* 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage and is either knocked prone or pulled up to 25 feet closer to the bender. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't pulled or knocked prone.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bender makes two Fangs of the Fire Snake attacks.

action.name: Fangs of the Fire Snake
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. *Hit:* 13 ({@damage 2d10 + 2}) fire damage.

action.name: Fist of Four Thunders
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and each creature other than the bender within 10 feet that can see and hear the bender must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) thunder damage.

trait.name: Deflect Missiles
entries: When the drunken master is hit by a ranged weapon attack, the damage is reduced by 25 ({@dice 1d10 + 20}).

trait.name: Drunkard's Luck (1/Turn)
entries: When the drunken master has disadvantage on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, it can choose either result for that roll.

trait.name: Drunken Technique
entries: The drunken master does not trigger opportunity attacks when it moves on its turn. Also, when prone, the drunken master can spend 5 feet of movement to stand up.

trait.name: Ki Fists
entries: The drunken master's unarmed strikes are magical.

trait.name: Legendary Resistances (3/Day)
entries: When the drunken master fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Lucky (3/Day)
entries: The drunken master can re-roll an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw it makes and use either result.

trait.name: Slow Fall
entries: The drunken master takes no damage as a result of a fall.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the drunken master isn't wearing armor, its armor class equals 10 plus its Dexterity modifier plus its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drunken master makes two unarmed strikes against each creature within 5 feet of its position.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Redirect Attack
entries: When a creature misses the drunken master with a melee attack roll, the drunken master can use its reaction to cause that attack to hit one creature of its choice, other than the attacker, that it can see within 5 feet of it.

trait.name: Circle of Mortality
entries: When the cleric would normally roll one or more dice to restore hit points with a spell to a creature at 0 hit points, it instead uses the highest number possible for each die.

action.name: Scythe
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 13 ({@damage 2d12}) slashing damage.

action.name: Protect the Dying
entries: The cleric targets up to three unconscious creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. Each target is stabilised.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cleric is a 6th-level spellcaster. It spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Aura of Courage
entries: The aspect and friendly creatures within 30 feet of it can't be frightened while the aspect is conscious.

trait.name: Sacred Weapons
entries: The aspect's weapon attacks are magical. When the aspect hits with its maul, the weapon deals an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Vow of Enmity (Recharges After a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the aspect targets a creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The aspect always knows in which direction its target can be found, and the aspect has advantage on attack rolls against the creature until the creature dies or the aspect chooses another target.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aspect uses its Abjure Enemy, if it can. It then makes three attacks with its maul.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Abjure Enemy (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The aspect targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The creature must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw, and the creature has disadvantage on its save if it is a fiend or undead. On a successful save, the the creature is frightened for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. While frightened, the creature's speed is 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to speed. On a successful save, the creature's speed is halved for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. This action has no effect on creatures immune to being frightened.

trait.name: Aura of Warding
entries: The feysworn and friendly creatures within 30 feet of it have resistance to damage from spells.

trait.name: Sacred Weapons
entries: The feysworn's weapon attacks are magical. When the feysworn hits with its sickle, the weapon deals an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage (included in the attack).

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The feysworn's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells innately.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The feysworn uses its Nature's Wrath, if it can. It then makes two attacks with its sickle.

action.name: Sickle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Nature's Wrath (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The feysworn targets a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained by magical vines for 1 minute. The target can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Forge Soul
entries: While wearing heavy armor, the priest gains a +1 bonus to AC.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The priest's melee weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Forge Hammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or ignite in flames. At the start of each of the target's turns, the target makes another Constitution saving throw, taking 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or ending the effect on a success. If the target or a creature within 5 feet of it uses an action to put out the flames, or if some other effect douses the flames, the effect ends.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. *Hit:* 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Mantle of Whispers
entries: The bard weaves a shadow it has captured through its Whispers of Death like a puppet. The bard vanishes, magically transforming into a disguise of the person whose shadow the bard has captured. The bard takes on the appearance of the dead person, but healthy and alive. The disguise lasts for 1 hour until the bard ends it as a bonus action. While in the disguise, the bard gains access to all information that the humanoid would freely share with a casual acquaintance and can easily pass as the person by drawing on its memories. Another creature can see through the disguise by succeeding on a DC 17 Wisdom (Insight) check.

reaction.name: Whispers of Death (Recharges on a Long Rest)
entries: When a humanoid dies within 30 feet of the bard, it can use its reaction to magically capture the humanoid's shadow. The bard retains this shadow until it uses its Mantle of Whispers action or completes a long rest.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bard is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). It has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Blade Flourish (1/Turn)
entries: When the blade hits with an attack on its turn, the blade can use one of the following options.
Defensive Flourish.** The blade rolls {@dice 1d8} and adds the amount to the damage of its attack. It also adds this amount to its AC until the start of its next turn.

Mobile Flourish.** The blade rolls {@dice 1d8} and adds the amount to the damage of its attack. Additionally, the blade pushes its target a number of feet equal to 5 + the amount rolled. The blade can then move up to its speed.
Slashing Flourish.** The blade chooses a creature within 5 feet of its original target. Both targets take an additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blade makes three attacks with its shortswords.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The blade is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). It has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Song of Rest
entries: The bard can perform a song while taking a short rest. Any ally who hears the song regains an extra {@dice 1d6} hit points if it spends any Hit Dice to regain hit points at the end of that rest. The bard can confer this benefit on itself as well.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Cutting Words
entries: When a creature the bard can see within 60 feet of it makes an attack roll, ability check, or damage roll, the bard subtract 4 (1d8) from the result. This has no effect if the creature can't hear the bard or is immune to being charmed.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bard is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Majesty
entries: The first time a creature attacks the bard on a turn, the attacker must make a DC 13 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it can't attack the bard on this turn, and it must choose a new target for the attack or the attack is wasted.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bard is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). It has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Aura of the Sea
entries: Creatures that start their turn within 5 feet of the storm herald must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the storm herald can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. *Hit:* 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack. Additionally, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or fall prone.

trait.name: Animal Companion
entries: The beastmaster is bonded to a beast, which is its animal companion. The companion acts on its own initiative, but otherwise obeys the beastmaster's commands. As a bonus action, the beastmaster can command its companion to use its reaction to take the Dash, Disengage, Dodge, or Help action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The beastmaster makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. *Hit:* 4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. *Hit:* 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

The beastmaster's challenge rating doesn't include its animal companion. Since we're not strictly limited by what the class can actually do, we can give the beastmaster any animal companion available in a published book. Included are some randomly-picked suggestions.

entries.name: {@creature Dire Wolf}
entries: The enormous hound sticks loyally by the woman's heel, head down, fangs bared. Its eyes flick meaningfully to its master's face, reading her expression and relaxing when it sees that she's in a good mood.

entries.name: {@creature Giant Scorpion}
entries: The clicking of its claws fades as its master strokes its head. "Not yet," the man says. "Knock them out first." And with that, the stinger shoots down.

entries.name: {@creature Hunter Shark}
entries: The merfolk seems surprised to see a boat so far out to sea. He uncorks a potion to release a foul-smelling aroma, and in less than a minute, a fin emerges from the waters. A striped shark sidles up beside him, nudging him for food.

entries.name: {@creature Tyrannosaurus Rex}
entries: The monster leaps across the plains, crossing the width of rivers in a single bound, shaking the foundations of the earth with every thunderous step. Clinging to its neck, hollering words of encouragement, is a little old lady gnome.

entries.name: {@creature Quetzalcoatlus|VGM}
entries: The sky darkens and the usual lively sounds of birds chirping goes deadly silent. A single flap of the beast's wings sends the grass bouncing and dancing. With a gust strong enough to blow down a house, the beast lands in front of its master.

entries.name: {@creature Aurochs|VGM}
entries: The young hill dwarf can barely hold on as the big-horned creature sprints at the side of the red barn. He hides his face just before he feels the crunch of splintering wood.

entries.name: {@creature Goat}
entries: The ranger kneels down by her goat and lifts up its big floppy ear. She whispers, "If you don't stop eating random trash while we're supposed to be fighting off orcs, I'll take you to the market and trade you for a box of apples."

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The scout has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Choose one of the Following
entries: To get across the flavour of a hunter of big game, you can give scouts one of the following abilities:

trait.name: Colossus Slayer (1/Turn)
entries: The scout deals an additional 4 ({@dice 1d8}) damage with its weapons when it hits a creature below its hit point maximum.

trait.name: Giant Killer
entries: When a Large or larger creature hits or misses the scout with a melee weapon attack, the scout can immediately make one weapon attack against that creature. (Reaction).

trait.name: Horde Breaker
entries: When the scout hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can use its bonus action to make the same attack against a different creature within 5 feet of the original target and within range of its weapon.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scout makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, ranged 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Ancestral Demise
entries: When the inheritor dies, it disintegrates and becomes an ancestral spirit, joining the other ancestral spirits as they pass on to guard one of the inheritor's children chosen at random. If the inheritor has no children, it dies, along with all of its ancestral spirits.

trait.name: Ancestral Protectors
entries: In battle, the inheritor is surrounded and protected by ancestral spirits, the souls of its ancestors. The first time the inheritor hits a creature with a melee weapon attack on its turn, the creature becomes the target of the ancestral spirits, hindering its attacks. The target has disadvantage on attacks rolls until the start of the inheritor's next turn.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the inheritor isn't wearing armor, its armor class is 10 plus its Dexterity modifier plus its Consitution modifier.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The inheritor's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13). It can cast the following spells innately:
1/Day: *augury, clairvoyance*

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The inheritor makes two attacks with its greataxe.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Spirit Shield
entries: When a creature the inheritor can see within 30 feet of it takes damage from an attack, the inheritor can use its reaction to provide aid through its ancestral spirits, reducing the damage by 7 ({@dice 2d6}) hit points.

trait.name: Beyond Death (3/Day)
entries: When the zealot is reduced to 0 hit points by an attack that isn't a critical hit, and the zealot is not killed outright, it can choose to fall to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: When the zealot fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the zealot can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zealot makes two attacks with Dawn Star.

action.name: Dawn Star
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 10 Charisma saving throw or begin glowing, shedding bright light in a 10 foot radius and dim light 10 feet beyond that. The glowing light grants advantage on attack rolls against the target, and it lasts until the start of the target's turn.

trait.name: Fighting Spirit (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the samurai gains 10 temporary hit points, plus advantage on melee weapon attacks until the end of its turn.

trait.name: Master of the Blade (1/Turn)
entries: When the samurai makes a melee weapon attack against a creature on its turn, it can add one of the following effects to its attack:

Disarming Attack.** The samurai chooses an item its target is holding. On a hit, the target takes an additional 5 ({@damage 1d10}) slashing damage and must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or drop the object. The object lands at its feet.
Lunging Attack.** The samurai's reach for the attack is increased by 5 feet. On a hit, the target takes an additional 5 ({@damage 1d10}) slashing damage.

Pushing Attack.** On a hit, the target takes an additional 5 ({@damage 1d10}) slashing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the samurai.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The samurai makes three attacks with its katana.

action.name: Katana
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if wielded with two hands to make a melee attack.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The samurai adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the samurai must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Eye for Detail
entries: The inquisitor has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks, and a +5 bonus to its passive Perception and passive Investigation scores.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The inquisitor deals an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the inquisitor that isn't incapacitated and the inquisitor doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll. The inquisitor also doesn't need advantage if it has detected the presence of deceptive magic from its target creature using its Unerring Eye.

trait.name: Unerring Eye (3/Day)
entries: The inquisitor can use a bonus action to sense the presence of illusions, shapechangers not in their original form, and other magic designed to deceive the senses within 30 feet of it, provided it isn't blinded or deafened. The inquisitor senses only the presence of these effects, not their form.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The inquisitor makes two shortsword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. *Hit:* 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Totem of the Bear
entries: Hostile creatures within 5 feet of the barbarian that can see and hear it have disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than the barbarian.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The barbarian's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13). It can cast the following spells innately, but only as a ritual:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The barbarian makes four attacks with its scimitars.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.
Variants

Your NPC barbarian might have an eagle totem or a wolf totem instead. The barbarian loses its Athletics proficiency, its ***Totem of the Bear*** feature, and its damage resistances (except bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons). Its CR is unaffected.
Eagle Totem Barbarian
The barbarian gains proficiency in the Perception skill and a fly speed of 40 feet.

monster.languages: Thieves' Cant plus any one language

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The assassin has advantage on attack rolls against creatures it has surprised.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The assassin deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that isn't incapacitated and the assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Dagger

action.name: Blowgun

trait.name: Totem of the Wolf (1/turn)
entries: When the barbarian hits a Large or smaller creature with a melee weapon attack, it can choose to force the target to make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. The target falls prone on a failed save.

trait.name: Angelic Weapons
entries: The chosen's weapon attacks are magical. When the chosen hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage (good) or necrotic damage (evil). This is included in the attack.

trait.name: Favored by the Gods
entries: The chosen magically adds 5 ({@dice 2d4}) to the result of each attack roll, ability check, and saving throw it makes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chosen makes two attacks with its royal scepter.

action.name: Royal Scepter
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage (good) or necrotic damage (evil).

headerEntries: The archdruid is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

monster.name: Arcane Thief
monster.languages: Thieves' Cant plus any three languages

trait.name: Invisible Hand
entries: The thief gains additional benefits when it casts *mage hand.* For a creature to notice the hand or the tasks the hand is performing, it must succeed on a Wisdom (Perception) check.
The hand created by the spell is invisible.
The thief can use the hand to stow or retrieve one object into or from a container worn or carried by another creature, or to use its Thieves' Tools.

The thief can use its bonus action to control the hand, or to distract a creature within range of the spell. If it distracts a creature, it gains advantage on attack rolls against the target until the end of the thief's turn.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The thief deals an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the thief that isn't incapacitated and the thief doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bard is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the adept is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Quivering Palm (Recharges After a Long Rest)
entries: When the adept hits a creature with an unarmed strike, it can apply hidden (but lethal) vibrations to their body. These vibrations last for 14 (4d6) days or until the adept uses this action on another creature, after which the effects end harmlessly. Otherwise, the adept can use its action to force the target to make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target falls to 0 hit points. On a successful save, the target takes 33 (6d10) necrotic damage. The adept can also choose to end the vibrations harmlessly as an action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The adept makes three unarmed strikes or three dart attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, the adept can choose one of the following additional effects:

items: The target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding (adept's choice).
The target must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the adept's next turn.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
entries: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, the adept deflects the missile. The damage it takes from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10 + 3}. If the damage is reduced to 0, the adept catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and the adept has a hand free.
